author: robocopsgonemad
content: do any client teams generate types from openrpc.json in the execution-api repo, or are interested in doing so?

author: robocopsgonemad
content: go, rust, and ts are supported.

author: ryangoree
content: Yes! I did a while back, but there were some errors, including repeated types in the output, so for now I'm not using them.

author: robocopsgonemad
content: interesting. java isn't supported, but it would be worth adding if other clients are using the stubs.

author: robocopsgonemad
content: i assumed you were using this https://github.com/open-rpc/typings to generate stubs?

author: ryangoree
content: Looks like I might have been using an outdated version: `npx open-rpc-typings -d "$temp_schema_out_path" --output-ts "$temp_out_dir" --name-ts "$ts_out_basename"`

author: ryangoree
content: Notice `open-rpc-typings` isn't scoped as it is in the readme of open-rpc/typings.

author: ryangoree
content: I'll try again tonight with all updated dependencies and report back üëç
